</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;5e8e9457.1503">   <title>Re: feedback DawnVanilla master </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;5e8e9457.1503</link>   <description> I did multiple materializes (from the command line) of DawnVanilla, both from the DLS internal repos, and from GitHub (--location=public). &quot;diff -r&quot; shows I got the same thing in all cases.<br>When building (using the IDE), sometimes I got the same &quot;error in u.a.d.scisoft.analysis.osgi, in plugin.xml&quot; that Michael got, sometimes I didn't.<br>As far as I can see, there is no error: u.a.d.scisoft.analysis.rcp.preference.root is defined in the fragment uk.ac.diamond.scisoft.analysis.rcp.contributions. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-12T09:28:23+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;5e8e9457.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;f6177e1.1503">   <title>Re: feedback DawnVanilla master </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;f6177e1.1503</link>   <description> I see the same problem in the downloaded DAWNVanilla zip. I also pulled down a vanilla workspace as per Gero's command line, but I get an error in u.a.d.scisoft.analysis.osgi, in plugin.xml. It can't find u.a.d.scisoft.analysis.rcp.preference.root which I *think* is an identifier which doesn't appear to be present in the Vanilla workspace (though it is in a Diamond workspace). I *think* this is screwing up the startup of the the FunctionFactoryExtensionService... (not sure how) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T12:37:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michael Wharmby</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;f6177e1.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;290dd4e9.1503">   <title>Re: feedback DawnVanilla master </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;290dd4e9.1503</link>   <description> Weird, working for me:<br><br>[cid:image001.png@01D05BF0.C74179A0]<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: DAWN Science Developers [mailto:DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Gero Flucke<br>Sent: 11 March 2015 11:42<br>To: DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: [DAWN-DEV] feedback DawnVanilla master<br><br>On Wed, 11 Mar 2015, Peter.Chang@Diamond.ac.uk&lt;mailto:Peter.Chang@Diamond.ac.uk&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt;<br><br>&gt; Hi Gero,<br><br>&gt;<br><br>&gt; 1) FIO passes its unit test and works for me<br><br>Hi Peter,<br><br>thanks for checking!<br><br>I did a fresh checkout using [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T11:44:51+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;290dd4e9.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;3278b589.1503">   <title>Re: feedback DawnVanilla master </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;3278b589.1503</link>   <description> From: http://opengda.org/DawnDiamond/master/downloads/builds-snapshot/<br><br>From: Gerring, Matt (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)<br>Sent: 11 March 2015 11:45<br>To: DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: RE: [DAWN-DEV] feedback DawnVanilla master<br><br>Weird, working for me:<br><br>[cid:image001.png@01D05BF1.06CC90A0]<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: DAWN Science Developers [mailto:DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Gero Flucke<br>Sent: 11 March 2015 11:42<br>To: DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&lt;mailto:DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&gt;<br>Subject: Re: [DAWN-DEV] feedback DawnVanilla master<br><br>On Wed, 11 Mar 2015, Peter.Chang@Diamond.ac.uk&lt;mailto:Peter.Chang@Diamond.ac.uk&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt;<br><br>&gt; Hi Gero,<br><br>&gt;<br><br>&gt; 1) FIO passes its unit test and works for me [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T11:46:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;3278b589.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;9cd3ddd1.1503">   <title>Re: feedback DawnVanilla master </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;9cd3ddd1.1503</link>   <description> Are you doing this testing with the binary nightly or a development workspace Gero?<br><br>Obviously development workspaces can compile yet not have required services because everything is so modular.<br><br>Matt<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: DAWN Science Developers [mailto:DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Gero Flucke<br>Sent: 11 March 2015 11:03<br>To: DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: [DAWN-DEV] feedback DawnVanilla master<br><br>Dear DAWN team,<br>you are probably aware of these issues, but I'd like to report to be sure...<br>I just did a fresh checkout of master and built DawnVanilla, but I see trouble with the product: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T11:36:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;9cd3ddd1.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;8e4a58a1.1503">   <title>Re: feedback DawnVanilla master </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;8e4a58a1.1503</link>   <description> On Wed, 11 Mar 2015, Peter.Chang@Diamond.ac.uk wrote:<br><br>&gt;<br>&gt; Hi Gero,<br>&gt;<br>&gt; 1) FIO passes its unit test and works for me<br><br>Hi Peter,<br>thanks for checking!<br>I did a fresh checkout using<br><br>./pewma.py --delete --workspace ~/workspaces/eclipse/dawn_March2015<br>--location=public -Dgithub.authentication.common=anonymous materialize<br>dawnvanilla dawn<br><br>and then built DawnVanilla as usual (Buckminster -&gt; Invoke action...).<br><br>&gt; apart from the message:<br>&gt; 11:18:25.795 ERROR FioLoader: Line (with data) '! Comment that done at some time!' does not match expected pattern '^((([-+]?[0-9]*\\.?[0-9]+([eE][-+]?[0-9]+)?)|(0\\.))\\s+)+(([-+]?[0-9]*\\.?[0-9]+([eE][-+]?[0-9]+)?)|(0\\.))$|^([-+]?[0-9]*\\.?[0-9]+([eE][-+]?[0-9]+)?)|(0\\.)$'! [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T12:42:04+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gero Flucke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;8e4a58a1.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;86c5971c.1503">   <title>Re: feedback DawnVanilla master </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;86c5971c.1503</link>   <description> Hi Gero,<br><br>1) FIO passes its unit test and works for me apart from the message:<br>11:18:25.795 ERROR FioLoader: Line (with data) '! Comment that done at some time!' does not match expected pattern '^((([-+]?[0-9]*\\.?[0-9]+([eE][-+]?[0-9]+)?)|(0\\.))\\s+)+(([-+]?[0-9]*\\.?[0-9]+([eE][-+]?[0-9]+)?)|(0\\.))$|^([-+]?[0-9]*\\.?[0-9]+([eE][-+]?[0-9]+)?)|(0\\.)$'!<br><br>2) Looks like a bug.<br><br>Thanks for reporting these problems,<br>Peter<br><br>&gt; -----Original Message-----<br>&gt; From: DAWN Science Developers [mailto:DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK]<br>&gt; On Behalf Of Gero Flucke<br>&gt; Sent: 11 March 2015 11:03<br>&gt; To: DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>&gt; Subject: [DAWN-DEV] feedback DawnVanilla master<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Dear DAWN team,<br>&gt; you are probably aware of these issues, but I'd like to report to be<br>&gt; sure...<br>> I [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T11:26:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;86c5971c.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;b04cddb2.1503">   <title>feedback DawnVanilla master </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;b04cddb2.1503</link>   <description> Dear DAWN team,<br>you are probably aware of these issues, but I'd like to report to be<br>sure...<br>I just did a fresh checkout of master and built DawnVanilla, but I see<br>trouble with the product:<br><br>1)<br>Reading .fio files is broken again:<br>(Isn't there a unit test for that now, thanks to Peter?)<br><br>If I do File-&gt; Open File from the menu, the file seesm to be empty, no<br>datasets are found. The console shows these errors: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-11T12:03:03+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gero Flucke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;b04cddb2.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;537a8505.1503">   <title>One day workshop on Automating and Simplifying Reduction of 2D powder diffraction data with DAWN </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;537a8505.1503</link>   <description> Dear All,<br><br>As part of the European Crystallography Meeting (http://ecm29.ecanews.org/&lt;http://ecm29.ecanews.org/programme/satellite-meetings/&gt;) there will be a one day satellite meeting on Automating and Simplifying Reduction of 2D powder diffraction data with DAWN.<br><br>Automating and Simplifying Reduction of 2D powder diffraction data with DAWN<br><br>Organizers: Diamond Light Source &amp; Croatian Association of Crystallographers<br><br>When? August 23rd, 2015 (Sunday), 10:00 AM - 4:30 PM [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T11:35:14+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alun Ashton</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;537a8505.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;47e851ad.1503">   <title>Re: [science-iwg] Getting started DAWNSci </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;47e851ad.1503</link>   <description> Hi Matthew,<br><br>Thank you for your answer and your tips.<br>Yes I know the Kichwa Coders\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd team, as we are also interested in the AnalysisRPC project.<br>We already use the compatibility layer as our application is made of IDE plugins, but it seems to be conflicting versions issues between bundles required by DAWN and bundles required by Eclipse platform 4.4. Nevertheless, in a first time, I will try to make a showcase with our own data format in the whole DAWN product as you suggested.<br>I will contact the dev team if I encounter blocking points for this demo. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-02T09:44:15+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>BERNARD, Alain</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;47e851ad.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;532fc102.1502">   <title>Java 8 for GDA and Dawn - DEFERRED </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;532fc102.1502</link>   <description> Please note the following change of plan: for the upcoming (March 2015) release of Dawn (1.8) and GDA (8.44), we will continue to use a Java 7 JVM.<br>That also means that the JRE bundled with the Dawn build will be Java 7.<br><br>Previously, the intention had been to use a Java 8 JVM, but restricting our code to Java 7 compatibility (so that we could fall back to a Java 7 JVM if required).<br>However, GDA and Java 8 do not play well together (ticket GDA-6112<http://jira.diamond.ac.uk/i#browse/GDA-6112>). A solution is under discussion (ticket GDA-6113<http://jira.diamond.ac.uk/i#browse/GDA-6113>), but in the meantime we will [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T16:29:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;532fc102.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;f60422af.1502">   <title>Matt's crazy and controversial rules for SWT handles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;f60422af.1502</link>   <description> With recent staff changes, I am concerned that SWT handles are being abused again because not everyone is aware of the issue. It causes your SWT app (GDA Client / DAWN for instance) to crash with a no more handles error:<br><br>Matt's crazy and controversial rules to keep handles from running out with SWT: [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T11:25:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;f60422af.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;fba15917.1502">   <title>Re: Matt's crazy and controversial rules for SWT handles </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;fba15917.1502</link>   <description> There's a plugin called sleak that can help check that you are doing things correctly: https://www.eclipse.org/swt/tools.php<br><br>Peter<br><br>From: Gerring, Matt (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)<br>Sent: 24 February 2015 11:26<br>To: Diamond GDA Developers; Aishima, Jun (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Ashton, Alun (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Basham, Mark (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Chang, Peter (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); El Kassaby, Baha (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Filik, Jacob (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Gerring, Matt (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Wharmby, Michael (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)<br>Cc: 'DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK'<br>Subject: Matt's crazy and controversial rules for SWT handles [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-24T11:29:19+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;fba15917.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;824fb422.1502">   <title>Re: OriginMetadata </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;824fb422.1502</link>   <description> Cool, no issue then :) I knew there was a lot of testing.<br><br>Cheers<br><br>Mark<br><br>Sent from Windows Mail<br><br>From: Filik, Jacob (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:Jacob.Filik@Diamond.ac.uk&gt;<br>Sent: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThursday\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd19\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFebruary\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd2015 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd10\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd:\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd44<br>To: Mark Basham&lt;mailto:Mark.Basham@diamond.ac.uk&gt;, Gerring, Matt (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:Matt.Gerring@Diamond.ac.uk&gt;, Chang, Peter (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:Peter.Chang@Diamond.ac.uk&gt;, Aishima, Jun (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:Jun.aishima@diamond.ac.uk&gt;, Ashton, Alun (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:Alun.Ashton@diamond.ac.uk&gt;, El Kassaby, Baha (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:baha.el-kassaby@diamond.ac.uk&gt;, Wharmby, Michael (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:michael.wharmby@diamond.ac.uk&gt;<br>Cc: 'DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK'&lt;mailto:DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&gt;<br><br>HierachicalFileExecutionVisitorTest tests this a lot! [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T10:45:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mark Basham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;824fb422.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;1f82528d.1502">   <title>Re: OriginMetadata </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;1f82528d.1502</link>   <description> HierachicalFileExecutionVisitorTest tests this a lot!<br><br>From: Basham, Mark (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)<br>Sent: 19 February 2015 10:43<br>To: Gerring, Matt (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Chang, Peter (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Aishima, Jun (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Ashton, Alun (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); El Kassaby, Baha (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Filik, Jacob (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Wharmby, Michael (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)<br>Cc: 'DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK'<br>Subject: Re: OriginMetadata<br><br>Just be slightly cautions that the processing uses the origin metadata heavily, and I know it tested but not comprehensively yet. myself and Jun can probably test by hand to make sure things not covered yet in testing still work. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T10:44:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jacob Filik</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;1f82528d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;e51a032f.1502">   <title>Re: OriginMetadata </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;e51a032f.1502</link>   <description> Just a quick comment, should this be in the ILazyLoader or higher up in the GUI that gives the slice to the plotting system? Just thinking of the case where a tif is being viewed line by line, would each line have the origin metadata since it is not coming from a lazy dataset (or is it now). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T10:42:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Jacob Filik</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;e51a032f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;eb4185a6.1502">   <title>Re: OriginMetadata </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;eb4185a6.1502</link>   <description> Just be slightly cautions that the processing uses the origin metadata heavily, and I know it tested but not comprehensively yet. myself and Jun can probably test by hand to make sure things not covered yet in testing still work.<br><br>Cheers<br><br>Mark<br><br>Sent from Windows Mail<br><br>From: Gerring, Matt (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:Matt.Gerring@Diamond.ac.uk&gt;<br>Sent: \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdThursday\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd19\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdFebruary\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd2015 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd09\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd:\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd30<br>To: Chang, Peter (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:Peter.Chang@Diamond.ac.uk&gt;, Aishima, Jun (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:Jun.aishima@diamond.ac.uk&gt;, Ashton, Alun (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:Alun.Ashton@diamond.ac.uk&gt;, Mark Basham&lt;mailto:Mark.Basham@diamond.ac.uk&gt;, El Kassaby, Baha (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:baha.el-kassaby@diamond.ac.uk&gt;, Filik, Jacob (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:Jacob.Filik@Diamond.ac.uk&gt;, Wharmby, Michael (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)&lt;mailto:michael.wharmby@diamond.ac.uk&gt;<br>Cc: 'DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK'&lt;mailto:DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK&gt; [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T10:42:41+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mark Basham</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;eb4185a6.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;d8bd7792.1502">   <title>Re: OriginMetadata </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;d8bd7792.1502</link>   <description> Hi Matt,<br><br>I think the only impediment is whether the metadata is serializable as I recently found that a lazy dataset with a HDF5 lazy loader wasn't for whatever reason (across CORBA). I haven't tracked the problem yet but it should be fixed.<br><br>Peter<br><br>From: Gerring, Matt (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)<br>Sent: 19 February 2015 09:03<br>To: Aishima, Jun (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Ashton, Alun (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Basham, Mark (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Chang, Peter (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); El Kassaby, Baha (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Filik, Jacob (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Gerring, Matt (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI); Wharmby, Michael (DLSLtd,RAL,LSCI)<br>Cc: 'DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK'<br>Subject: OriginMetadata [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T09:22:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;d8bd7792.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;eb6020a4.1502">   <title>OriginMetadata </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;eb6020a4.1502</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>I prepared some changes for setting an instance of OriginMetadata as metadata in from ILazyLoader. This provides a reference to the ILazyDataset in which a given slice belongs. This will mean than from a plotting tool, one can get a reference back to the ILazyDataset from which the slice came - for instance. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-19T09:02:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;eb6020a4.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;50af4be8.1502">   <title>Location and name of dawn-eclipse.git repository changed: affects DAWN and GDA master </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;50af4be8.1502</link>   <description> This email is about a Git repository that is used in DAWN and GDA. If is relevant to DAWN and GDA developers (not users).<br>This repository contains projects named like org.eclipse.dawnsci.*<br><br>As previously advised, the Git repository formerly located at git@github.com:DawnScience/dawn-eclipse.git<br>has been copied to the location git@github.com:eclipse/dawnsci.git (and changed name)<br>The old location will remain, but no updates will be accepted for it. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-18T10:18:20+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;50af4be8.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;d216676d.1502">   <title>Re: function integration? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;d216676d.1502</link>   <description> Hi Gero,<br><br>No, there are not any integration routines of 1D data or function at present in Dawn. There are two cases to cover: integrate a given dataset, and integrate a function (to a given accuracy). Perhaps you want to contribute a trapezoidal rule quadrature routine that works in a similar vein to NumPy's trapz for the former case. We could bind to the Apache Commons Math integrators for the latter case. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T10:51:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;d216676d.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;36433046.1502">   <title>Re: dawn-eclipse repo moving to eclipse/dawnsci on github </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;36433046.1502</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>This was just done, you should no longer be able to push to DawnScience/dawn-eclipse but don't have to panic about moving over, things will work for you for a while. Matt Webber will change the cspec for the buckminster build in due course (we have not done this yet I think:). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T16:37:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;36433046.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;b79fc61.1502">   <title>DAWN Feature Thaw version 1.8 Osprey </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;b79fc61.1502</link>   <description> When: 16 March 2015 00:00 to 17 March 2015 00:00 (UTC) Dublin, Edinburgh, Lisbon, London.<br>Where: Worldwide<br><br>Note: The GMT offset above does not reflect daylight saving time adjustments.<br><br>*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*<br><br>--<br>This e-mail and any attachments may contain confidential, copyright and or privileged material, and are for the use of the intended addressee only. If you are not the intended addressee or an authorised recipient of the addressee please notify us of receipt by returning the e-mail and do not use, copy, retain, distribute or disclose the information in or attached to the e-mail.<br>Any opinions expressed within this e-mail [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T10:59:37+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;b79fc61.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;fcf12bd6.1502">   <title>DAWN Feature Freeze version 1.8 Osprey </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;fcf12bd6.1502</link>   <description> When: 27 February 2015 00:00 to 28 February 2015 00:00 (UTC) Dublin, Edinburgh, Lisbon, London.<br>Where: Worldwide<br><br>Note: The GMT offset above does not reflect daylight saving time adjustments.<br><br>*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*<br><br>Feature freeze DAWN 1.8 at 17:00 GMT today<br><br>--<br>This e-mail and any attachments may contain confidential, copyright and or privileged material, and are for the use of the intended addressee only. If you are not the intended addressee or an authorised recipient of the addressee please notify us of receipt by returning the e-mail and do not use, copy, retain, distribute or disclose the information in or attached to [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T10:58:40+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;fcf12bd6.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;3fc7e522.1502">   <title>dawn-eclipse repo moving to eclipse/dawnsci on github </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;3fc7e522.1502</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>We are planning to move:<br>DawnScience/dawn-eclipse<br><br>To:<br>eclipse/dawnsci<br><br>on Github tomorrow afternoon.<br><br>* If you have any changes to the dawn-eclipse repo please merge them to master.<br>* The repo DawnScience/dawn-eclipse will be kept as read only from tomorrow afternoon, in case history is needed.<br>* Old branches will be left as is, master will be checked into eclipse/dawnsci<br>* If you would like to commit in future to the plugins on eclipse github, you will need to join the foundation and register as a committer. You can then commit with your existing github id. If you work at [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T16:31:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;3fc7e522.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;a8d3e3e.1502">   <title>function integration? </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;a8d3e3e.1502</link>   <description> Hi DAWN experts,<br>is there some function in DAWN that integrates numerically a 1D function<br>(i.e. AFunction or probably better IFunction)?<br>I only find sums, e.g., for 2D, Integrate2D.<br><br>Cheers<br><br>Gero    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T11:13:12+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gero Flucke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;a8d3e3e.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;721eb5c6.1502">   <title>Change to automatically loaded stacks </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;721eb5c6.1502</link>   <description> Hello,<br><br>I will merge back a small change which attempts to put scans of images into correctly named stacks when you open an image from a directory. At the moment all other images appear in one big stack. Please let me know if this is going to scupper anything you are doing - I am not aware of this making a difference to anyone :) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T16:19:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;721eb5c6.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;d9f7664.1502">   <title>Re: LorentzianSqr peak type </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;d9f7664.1502</link>   <description> Gero,<br><br>I expect the test ran despite that. Look in the junit view:<br><br>[cid:image001.png@01D0420B.D87D53F0]<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: DAWN Science Developers [mailto:DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Gero Flucke<br>Sent: 06 February 2015 12:04<br>To: DAWN-DEV@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: [DAWN-DEV] LorentzianSqr peak type<br><br>On Fri, 6 Feb 2015, Matt.Gerring@Diamond.ac.uk&lt;mailto:Matt.Gerring@Diamond.ac.uk&gt; wrote:<br><br>&gt; This is a welcome bit of news! Do you know how to do a pull request on [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T12:53:05+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;d9f7664.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;b61929c9.1502">   <title>Re: LorentzianSqr peak type </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;b61929c9.1502</link>   <description> On Fri, 6 Feb 2015, Matt.Gerring@Diamond.ac.uk wrote:<br><br>&gt; I expect the test ran despite that. Look in the junit view:<br><br>OK, right!<br>I was mislead since the console popped up with red text and I was not<br>aware of the JUnit view...<br><br>Now I have the things in master, but I do not see my function anymore in<br>the Function fitting tool (that worked in 171...). [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T14:04:42+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gero Flucke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;b61929c9.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;15687b20.1502">   <title>Re: LorentzianSqr peak type </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;15687b20.1502</link>   <description> On Fri, 6 Feb 2015, Matt.Gerring@Diamond.ac.uk wrote:<br><br>&gt; This is a welcome bit of news! Do you know how to do a pull request on<br>&gt; github? I think it is that you fork, push to the fork and then create a<br>&gt; request on the web page, Michael will accept the code, he is making<br>&gt; changes in that area too at the moment but it is not hard for us to<br>&gt; merge stuff in. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T13:03:44+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gero Flucke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;15687b20.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;db770f94.1502">   <title>Re: LorentzianSqr peak type </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;db770f94.1502</link>   <description> Hi Gero,<br><br>This is a welcome bit of news! Do you know how to do a pull request on github? I think it is that you fork, push to the fork and then create a request on the web page, Michael will accept the code, he is making changes in that area too at the moment but it is not hard for us to merge stuff in. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T11:33:49+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;db770f94.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;341270a3.1502">   <title>LorentzianSqr peak type </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;341270a3.1502</link>   <description> Dear DAWN folks,<br>as discussed a few weeks ago, I was able to create a new function for a<br>'Lorentzia squared' peak type and make it available in the Peak fitting<br>and Function fitting tools.<br><br>This peak type is mentioned e.g. in these publications:<br><br>http://dx.doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevB.49.12022<br>http://dx.doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevB.66.174105<br>http://iopscience.iop.org/0953-8984/7/14/005/pdf/cm951405.pdf<br><br>So far I did all this in a 171 vanilla. If you agree, I'd like to commit<br>the code to github - of course after integrating and testing it in master. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T12:19:26+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gero Flucke</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;341270a3.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;bd2b750.1502">   <title>Re: Support RAP DAWN </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;bd2b750.1502</link>   <description> Oh running DAWN with a RAP target is a much larger problem. I did it once for DAWN 1.5 but the RAP target requires internal fixes into DAWN. We decided that driving remote algorithms with remote data is better done from an RCP UI using web services, for various reasons. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-04T12:55:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator><></dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=DAWN-DEV;bd2b750.1502</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
